Koolhaas, Rem: The neatness of architecture is its seduction; it defines, excludes, limits, separates from the "rest" - but it also consumes. It exploits and exhausts the potentials that can be generated finally only by urbanism, and that only the specific imagination of urbanism can invent and renew.
